posts.content:
Here's how you can get Amazon to donate to the NRA on your behalf. All you have to do is go through their Amazon Smile program and select the NRA Foundation.

Copied from this NRA BLOG POST



Support The NRA Foundation and our Second Amendment rights every time you shop on Amazon

Fairfax, Virginia - The NRA Foundation, America's leading charitable organization in support of the shooting sports, is now a part of AmazonSmile.

What's AmazonSmile? It's a philanthropy program that contributes a portion of your Amazon.com purchase to a charity of your choice. And there's no additional cost passed on to you. Amazon takes the donation out of their end and will continue to offer its vast selection of products at the same low prices you've come to expect.

Nearly one million charities are featured on AmazonSmile, but with the addition of The NRA Foundation, there's no better organization to support firearm-related public interest activities that promote fun and safety and encourage the next generation of firearms enthusiasts.

If you already have an Amazon account you can add AmazonSmile right on top. No new registration required! To add The NRA Foundation as your charity, sign in at https://smile.amazon.com/

Once logged in:

Click on Your Account to the right of the search bar.
Under Settings category: Select Change Your Charity
Search for “The NRA Foundation, Inc.”
Click Select next to The NRA Foundation, Inc.
Then continue shopping as usual.

Contributions are submitted back to the Foundation through quarterly payments to the Foundation general contribution fund. Any donations to the Foundation prior to August 21, 2014 will be consolidated into our next quarterly payment from AmazonSmile.


(highlighted and pinned - Paul])

I support the NRA Civil Rights Defense Fund.
The NRA Civil Rights Defense Fund was established by the NRA Board of Directors in 1978 to become involved in court cases establishing legal precedents in favor of gun owners.

To accomplish this, the Fund provides legal and financial assistance to selected individuals and organizations defending their right to keep and bear arms.

Additionally, the Fund sponsors legal research and education on a wide variety of firearms related issues, including the meaning of the Second Amendment and nature of the right to keep and bear arms provisions in state constitutions.

The NRA Foundation, Inc. for me.

The NRA Foundation, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization that raises tax-deductible contributions in support of a wide range of firearm-related public interest activities of the National Rifle Association of America and other organizations that defend and foster the Second Amendment rights of all law-abiding Americans. These activities are designed to promote firearms and hunting safety, to…
posts.signature: Self aware sack of star stuff

posts.content: Now when you shop at smile.amazon.com, your purchases will support NRA Civil Rights Defense Fund.

I had purple heart homes on there before but honestly forgot to use the "smile" URL. Changed to NRA civil defense fund and bookmarked the smile url so I remember to use it.

Thanks for posting!

Admin's should cross post and make sticky on all of these threads. 300k members here, we could raise a lot of money over the next couple of months.

OP, please change your subject line to show smile.amazon, instead of amazon. I think that will help and good job on posting this!!!
I also do this; and try not to forget to use the smile site. I agree a sticky would be a good idea.
I have my Smile set to the Lone Survivor Foundation.
posts.signature: Chili has no meat & no beans

posts.content: I make my smile.amazon donation to the SAF (Second Amendment Foundation). In my research they do much more to fight the unreasonable gun laws.

Originally Posted By bmarshall1:
I make my smile.amazon donation to the SAF (Second Amendment Foundation). In my research they do much more to fight the unreasonable gun laws.


I didn't see them on smile before so I was donating to the NRA. But I was just looking if you shop at Amazon through the SAF's referral link: http://www.saf.org/amazon/ they get a cut that way. I can't find an exact amount but it seems like it is more than the .5% from Smile.

I'm changing my Amazon bookmark to that from now on.

Should have done it sooner
